page.title: 11 Osborne House Visit (3)
page.content:
Here are some of the rooms that we saw: { { The Durbar Room This room is big and on the ground floor. It is filed with objects from India. The furniture is made of mahogany. There are lovely carvings, in Plaster of Paris, on the walls. But the ceiling really caught my eye, because the carvings were so delicate and it must have taken months to complete.
{The Billiard Room This is a very grand room. The actual billiard table's legs are made out of ivory and the cloth is green velvet and two chandeliers used to hang over the billiard table in Victoria's day, but now electric lights hang in their place.
